png-alpha.title: PNG alpha transparency
png-alpha.notes: IE6 does support full transparency in 8-bit PNGs, which can sometimes be an alternative to 24-bit PNGs.

apng.title: Animated PNG (APNG)
apng.description: Like animated GIFs, but allowing 24-bit colors and alpha transparency
apng.notes: Where support for APNG is missing, only the first frame is displayed

video.title: Video element
video.description: Method of playing videos on webpages (without requiring a plug-in)

links.title: Video on the Web - includes info on Android support

video.notes:
Different browsers have support for different video formats, see sub-features for details. 

The Android browser (before 2.3) requires [specific handling](http://www.broken-links.com/2010/07/08/making-html5-video-work-on-android-phones/) to run the video element.

audio.title: Audio element
audio.description: Method of playing sound on webpages (without requiring a plug-in)

links.title: Demos of audio player that uses the audio element

contenteditable.title: contenteditable attribute (basic support)
contenteditable.description: Method of making any HTML element editable
contenteditable.notes: This support only refers to very basic editing capability, implementations vary significantly on how certain elements can be edited.

dragndrop.title: Drag and Drop
dragndrop.description: Method of easily dragging and dropping elements on a page, requiring minimal JavaScript.
dragndrop.notes: Partial support in older IE refers to no support for the dataTransfer.files or .types objects and limited supported formats for dataTransfer.setData/getData. dataTransfer.items only supported by google chrome. IE has no support for .setDragImage. Firefox supports any kind of DOM elements for .setDragImage. Chrome must have either an HTMLImageElement or any kind of DOM elements attached to the DOM and within the viewport of the browser for .setDragImage.

queryselector.title: querySelector/querySelectorAll
queryselector.description: Method of accessing DOM elements using CSS selectors
queryselector.notes: Only works for the CSS selectors available. Thus the IE8 implementation is limited to the CSS 2.1 selectors

getelementsbyclassname.title: getElementsByClassName
getelementsbyclassname.description: Method of accessing DOM elements by class name

forms.title: HTML5 form features
forms.description: Expanded form options, including things like date pickers, sliders, validation, placeholders and multiple file uploads. Previously known as "Web forms 2.0".

links.title: HTML5 inputs and attribute support page
Cross-browser JS implementation (based on original spec)

html5semantic.title: New semantic elements
html5semantic.description: HTML5 offers some new elements, primarily for semantic purposes. The elements include: section, article, aside, header, footer, nav, figure, figcaption, time, mark, main.
html5semantic.notes: Partial support refers to missing the default styling. This is easily taken care of by using display:block for all new elements (except time and mark, these should be display:inline anyway). IE11 and older versions of other browsers do not support the <main> element.

notes_by_num.1: Does not include support for the <main> element

offline-apps.title: Offline web applications
offline-apps.description: Method of defining web page files to be cached using a cache manifest file, allowing them to work offline on subsequent visits to the page

webworkers.title: Web Workers
webworkers.description: Method of running scripts in the background, isolated from the web page

fontface.title: @font-face Web fonts
fontface.description: Method of displaying fonts downloaded from websites
fontface.notes: Partial support before IE9 refers to only supporting EOT fonts. Safari for iOS 4.1 and below only supports SVG fonts.

eot.title: EOT - Embedded OpenType fonts
eot.description: Type of font that can be derived from a regular font, allowing small files and legal use of high-quality fonts. Usage is restricted by the file being tied to the website
eot.notes: Proposal by Microsoft, being considered for W3C standardization.

woff.title: WOFF - Web Open Font Format
woff.description: Compressed TrueType/OpenType font that contains information about the font's source.
woff.notes: Reported to be supported in some modified versions of the Android 4.0 browser.

multibackgrounds.title: CSS3 Multiple backgrounds
multibackgrounds.description: Method of using multiple images as a background

border-image.title: CSS3 Border images
border-image.description: Method of using images for borders
border-image.notes: Note that both the border-style and border-width must be specified for border-images to work according to spec, though older implementations may not have this requirement. Partial support refers to supporting the shorthand syntax, but not the individual properties (border-image-source, border-image-slice, etc).

background-img-opts.title: CSS3 Background-image options
background-img-opts.description: New properties to affect background images, including background-clip, background-origin and background-size
background-img-opts.notes: Partial support in Opera Mini refers to not supporting background sizing or background attachments. However Opera Mini 7.5 supports background sizing (including cover and contain values). Partial support in Safari 6 refers to not supporting background sizing offset from edges syntax.

css-table.title: CSS Table display
css-table.description: Method of displaying elements as tables, rows, and cells

css-gencontent.title: CSS Generated content for pseudo-elements
css-gencontent.description: Method of displaying text or images before or after the given element's contents using the :before and :after pseudo-elements
css-gencontent.notes:
IE8 only supports the single-colon CSS 2.1 syntax (i.e. :pseudo-class). It does not support the double-colon CSS3 syntax (i.e. ::pseudo-element)

For content to appear in pseudo-elements, the `content` property must be set (but may be an empty string).

css-fixed.title: CSS position:fixed
css-fixed.description: Method of keeping an element in a fixed location regardless of scroll position
css-fixed.notes: Only works in Android 2.2+ by using the following meta tag: <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, user-scalable=no">. Partial support in iOS Safari refers to [buggy behavior](http://remysharp.com/2012/05/24/issues-with-position-fixed-scrolling-on-ios/).

hashchange.title: Hashchange event
hashchange.description: Event triggered in JavaScript when the URL's hash has changed (for example: page.html#foo to page.html#bar)

css-sel2.title: CSS 2.1 selectors
css-sel2.description: Basic CSS selectors including: * (universal selector), > (child selector), :first-child, :link, :visited, :active, :hover, :focus, :lang(), + (adjacent sibling selector), [attr], [attr="val"], [attr~="val"], [attr|="bar"], .foo (class selector), #foo (id selector)

css-sel3.title: CSS3 selectors
css-sel3.description: Advanced element selection using selectors including: [foo^="bar"], [foo$="bar"], [foo*="bar"], :root, :nth-child(),  :nth-last-child(), nth-of-type, nth-last-of-type(), :last-child,  :first-of-type, :last-of-type, :only-child, :only-of-type, :empty, :target, :enabled, :disabled, :checked, :not(), ~ (general sibling)
css-sel3.notes: IE7 and IE8 support only these CSS3 selectors: General siblings (element1~element2) and Attribute selectors [attr^=val], [attr$=val], and [attr*=val]

css-textshadow.title: CSS3 Text-shadow
css-textshadow.description: Method of applying one or more shadow or blur effects to text
css-textshadow.notes: Opera Mini ignores the blur-radius set, so no blur effect is visible. Text-shadow behavior can be somewhat emulated in older IE versions using the non-standard "dropshadow" or "glow" filters.

css-boxshadow.title: CSS3 Box-shadow
css-boxshadow.description: Method of displaying an inner or outer shadow effect to elements
css-boxshadow.notes: Can be partially emulated in older IE versions using the non-standard "shadow" filter. Partial support in Safari, iOS Safari and Android Browser refers to missing "inset" and blur radius value support.

css3-colors.title: CSS3 Colors
css3-colors.description: Method of describing colors using Hue, Saturation and Lightness (hsl()) rather than just RGB, as well as allowing alpha-transparency with rgba() and hsla().

css3-boxsizing.title: CSS3 Box-sizing
css3-boxsizing.description: Method of specifying whether or not an element's borders and padding should be included in size units
css3-boxsizing.notes: Partial support refers to supporting only the "border-box" value, not "padding-box" (which was added to the spec later).

css-mediaqueries.title: CSS3 Media Queries
css-mediaqueries.description: Method of applying styles based on media information. Includes things like page and device dimensions
css-mediaqueries.notes: Incomplete support by older webkit browsers refers to only acknowledging different media rules on page reload

multicolumn.title: CSS3 Multiple column layout
multicolumn.description: Method of flowing information in multiple columns
multicolumn.notes: Partial support refers to not supporting the break-before, break-after, break-inside properties. Webkit browsers do have equivalent support for the non-standard -webkit-column-break-* properties.

border-radius.title: CSS3 Border-radius (rounded corners)
border-radius.description: Method of making the border corners round

transforms2d.title: CSS3 Transforms
transforms2d.description: Method of transforming an element including rotating, scaling, etc.
transforms2d.notes: The scale transform can be emulated in IE < 9 using Microsoft's "zoom" extension, others are (not easily) possible using the MS Matrix filter

use-strict.title: ECMAScript 5 Strict Mode
use-strict.description: Method of placing code in a "strict" operating context.
use-strict.notes: Partial support in older Safari refers to strict mode still accepting a lot of JS that should be considered invalid.

transforms3d.title: CSS3 3D Transforms
transforms3d.description: Method of transforming an element in the third dimension
transforms3d.notes: Partial support in IE refers to not supporting [the transform-style: preserve-3d property](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/hh673529%28v=vs.85%29.aspx#the_ms_transform_style_property). This prevents nesting 3D transformed elements.

sharedworkers.title: Shared Web Workers
sharedworkers.description: Method of allowing multiple scripts to communicate with a single web worker.

css-hyphens.title: CSS Hyphenation
css-hyphens.description: Method of controlling when words at the end of lines should be hyphenated using the "hyphens" property.
css-hyphens.notes: Chrome 29- and Android 4.0 Browser support "-webkit-hyphens: none", but not the "auto" property. Chrome 30+ doesn't support it either.

css-transitions.title: CSS3 Transitions
css-transitions.description: Simple method of animating certain properties of an element

links.title: Animation of property types support in Opera

font-feature.title: Font feature settings
font-feature.description: Method of applying advanced typographic and language-specific font features to supported OpenType fonts.
font-feature.notes: Partial support in older Firefox versions refers to using an older syntax. Partial support in older Chrome versions refers to lacking support in Mac OS X.

css-animation.title: CSS3 Animation
css-animation.description: Complex method of animating certain properties of an element
css-animation.notes: Partial support in Android browser refers to buggy behavior in different scenarios.

css-gradients.title: CSS Gradients
css-gradients.description: Method of defining a linear or radial color gradient as a CSS image.

links.title: Tool to emulate support in IE

css-gradients.notes:
Syntax used by browsers with prefixed support may be incompatible with that for proper support. 

Partial support in Opera 11.10 and 11.50 also refers to only having support for linear gradients.

Support can be somewhat emulated in older IE versions using the non-standard "gradient" filter. 

Firefox 10+, Opera 11.6+, Chrome 26+ and IE10+ also support the new "to (side)" syntax.

css-canvas.title: CSS Canvas Drawings
css-canvas.description: Method of using HTML5 Canvas as a background image
css-canvas.notes: Proposal by Webkit, being considered for W3C standardization. A similar effect can be achieved in Firefox 4+ using the -moz-element() background property

css-reflections.title: CSS Reflections
css-reflections.description: Method of displaying a reflection of an element
css-reflections.notes: Similar effect can be achieved in Firefox 4+ using the -moz-element() background property

css-masks.title: CSS Masks
css-masks.description: Method of displaying part of an element, using a selected image as a mask
css-masks.notes: Partial support in WebKit/Blink browsers refers to supporting the mask-image and mask-box-image properties, but lacks support for othe parts of the spec. Partial support in Firefox refers to only support for inline SVG mask elements i.e. mask: url(#foo).

svg.title: SVG (basic support)
svg.description: Method of displaying basic Vector Graphics features using the embed or object elements. Refers to the SVG 1.1 spec.

svg-css.title: SVG in CSS backgrounds
svg-css.description: Method of using SVG images as CSS backgrounds
svg-css.notes: Partial support in older Firefox and Opera Mini/Mobile refers to SVG images being blurry when scaled. Partial support in iOS Safari and older Safari versions refers to failing to support tiling or the background-position property.

svg-smil.title: SVG SMIL animation
svg-smil.description: Method of using animation elements to animate SVG images

links.title: Polyfill for SMIL animate events on SVG
JS library to support SMIL in SVG

svg-smil.notes: Partial support in Safari refers to not working in HTML files.

svg-fonts.title: SVG fonts
svg-fonts.description: Method of using fonts defined as SVG shapes

links.title: Blog post on usage for iPad

svg-fonts.notes: Supported in Opera Mini in SVG images only, not in HTML.

svg-filters.title: SVG filters
svg-filters.description: Method of using photoshop-like effects on SVG objects including blurring and color manipulation.

svg-html.title: SVG effects for HTML
svg-html.description: Method of using SVG transforms, filters, etc on HTML elements using either CSS or the foreignObject element
svg-html.notes: Partial support refers to lack of filter support or buggy result from effects. A [CSS Filter Effects](https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/FXTF/raw-file/tip/filters/index.html) specification is in the works that would replace this method.

svg-html5.title: Inline SVG in HTML5
svg-html5.description: Method of using SVG tags directly in HTML documents. Requires HTML5 parser.

canvas.title: Canvas (basic support)
canvas.description: Method of generating fast, dynamic graphics using JavaScript
canvas.notes: Opera Mini supports the canvas element, but is unable to play animations or run other more complex applications. Android 2.x supports canvas except the toDataURL() function. See http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=7901 Some (slow) workarounds are described here: http://stackoverflow.com/q/10488033/841830

canvas-text.title: Text API for Canvas
canvas-text.description: Method of displaying text on Canvas elements

namevalue-storage.title: Web Storage - name/value pairs
namevalue-storage.description: Method of storing data locally like cookies, but for larger amounts of data (sessionStorage and localStorage, used to fall under HTML5).

sql-storage.title: Web SQL Database
sql-storage.description: Method of storing data client-side, allows Sqlite database queries for access and manipulation
sql-storage.notes: The Web SQL Database specification is no longer being maintained and support may be dropped in future versions.

indexeddb.title: IndexedDB
indexeddb.description: Method of storing data client-side, allows indexed database queries. Previously known as WebSimpleDB API.
indexeddb.notes: Partial support in IE 10 & 11 refers to a number of subfeatures [not being supported](http://codepen.io/cemerick/pen/Itymi). Partial support in BB10 refers to an [outdated specification](http://www.w3.org/TR/2011/WD-IndexedDB-20110419/) being implemented. Code targeting the [current state of the specification](http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/) might not work.

eventsource.title: Server-sent DOM events
eventsource.description: Method of continuously sending data from a server to the browser, rather than repeatedly requesting it (EventSource interface, used to fall under HTML5)

x-doc-messaging.title: Cross-document messaging
x-doc-messaging.description: Method of sending information from a page on one domain to a page on a different one (using postMessage)
x-doc-messaging.notes: Partial support in IE8-9 refers to only working in frames/iframes (not other tabs/windows). Also in IE 9 and below an object cannot be sent using postMessage. Partial support in IE10 refers to [limitations in certain conditions](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16226924/is-cross-origin-postmessage-broken-in-ie10)

datauri.title: Data URIs
datauri.description: Method of embedding images and other files in webpages as a string of text
datauri.notes: Support in Internet Explorer 8 is limited to images and linked resources like CSS files, not HTML files. Max URI length in IE8 is 32KB. In IE9+ JavaScript files are supported too and the maximum size limit set to 4GB.

mathml.title: MathML
mathml.description: Special tags that allow mathematical formulas and notations to be written on web pages.
mathml.notes: Opera's support is limited to a CSS profile of MathML. Support was added in Chrome 24, but removed afterwards due to instability.

css-featurequeries.title: CSS Feature Queries
css-featurequeries.description: CSS Feature Queries allow authors to condition rules based on whether particular property declarations are supported in CSS using the @supports at rule.

xhtml.title: XHTML served as application/xhtml+xml
xhtml.description: A strict form of HTML, and allows embedding of other XML languages
xhtml.notes: The XHTML syntax is very close to HTML, and thus is almost always ([incorrectly](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/XHTML#MIME_type_versus_DOCTYPE)) served as text/html on the web.

xhtmlsmil.title: XHTML+SMIL animation
xhtmlsmil.description: Method of using SMIL animation in web pages
xhtmlsmil.notes: Internet Explorer supports the W3C proposal HTML+TIME, which is largely the same as XHTML+SMIL

wai-aria.title: WAI-ARIA Accessibility features
wai-aria.description: Method of providing ways for people with disabilities to use dynamic web content and web applications.

geolocation.title: Geolocation
geolocation.description: Method of informing a website of the user's geographical location

flexbox.title: Flexible Box Layout Module
flexbox.description: Method of positioning elements in horizontal or vertical stacks.

links.title: Article on using the latest spec
Examples on how to solve common layout problems with flexbox

flexbox.notes: Most partial support refers to supporting an [older version](http://www.w3.org/TR/2009/WD-css3-flexbox-20090723/) of the specification or an [older syntax](http://www.w3.org/TR/2012/WD-css3-flexbox-20120322/).

notes_by_num.3: Does not support flex-wrap or flex-flow properties

webgl.title: WebGL - 3D Canvas graphics
webgl.description: Method of generating dynamic 3D graphics using JavaScript, accelerated through hardware
webgl.notes:
Support listed as "partial" refers to the fact that not all users with these browsers have WebGL access. This is due to the additional requirement for users to have [up to date video drivers](http://www.khronos.org/webgl/wiki/BlacklistsAndWhitelists). This problem was [solved in Chrome](http://blog.chromium.org/2012/02/gpu-accelerating-2d-canvas-and-enabling.html) as of version 18.

Note that WebGL is part of the [Khronos Group](http://www.khronos.org/webgl/), not the W3C.

fileapi.title: File API
fileapi.description: Method of manipulating file objects in web applications client-side, as well as programmatically selecting them and accessing their data.
fileapi.notes: Partial support in older Safari and other WebKit browsers refers to lacking FileReader support.

shadowdom.title: Shadow DOM
shadowdom.description: Method of establishing and maintaining functional boundaries between DOM trees and how these trees interact with each other within a document, thus enabling better functional encapsulation within the DOM.

websockets.title: Web Sockets
websockets.description: Bidirectional communication technology for web apps
websockets.notes: Partial support refers to the websockets implementation using an older version of the protocol and/or the implementation being disabled by default (due to security issues with the older protocol).

script-async.title: async attribute for external scripts
script-async.description: The boolean async attribute on script elements allows the external JavaScript file to run when it's available, without delaying page load first.
script-async.notes: Using script.async = false; to maintain execution order for dynamically-added scripts isn't supported in Safari 5.0

cors.title: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
cors.description: Method of performing XMLHttpRequests across domains
cors.notes: Supported somewhat in IE8 and IE9 using the XDomainRequest object (but has [limitations]( http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ieinternals/archive/2010/05/13/xdomainrequest-restrictions-limitations-and-workarounds.aspx))

calc.title: calc() as CSS unit value
calc.description: Method of allowing calculated values for length units, i.e. width: calc(100% - 3em)
calc.notes: Support can be somewhat emulated in older versions of IE using the non-standard expression() syntax. Partial support in IE9 refers to the browser crashing when used as a background-position value.

ruby.title: Ruby annotation
ruby.description: Method of adding pronunciation or other annotations using ruby elements (primarily used in East Asian typography)
ruby.notes: Browsers without native support can still simulate support using CSS. Partial support refers to only supporting basic ruby, may still be missing writing-mode, Complex ruby and CSS3 Ruby

css-opacity.title: CSS3 Opacity
css-opacity.description: Method of setting the transparency level of an element
css-opacity.notes: Transparency for elements in IE8 and older can be achieved using the proprietary "filter" property and does not work well with PNG images using alpha transparency.

form-validation.title: Form validation
form-validation.description: Method of setting required fields and field types without requiring JavaScript
form-validation.notes: Partial support in Safari refers to lack of notice when form with required fields is attempted to be submitted. Partial support in IE10 mobile refers to lack of warning when blocking submission.

history.title: Session history management
history.description: Method of manipulating the user's browser's session history in JavaScript using history.pushState, history.replaceState and the popstate event
history.notes: Older iOS versions and Android 4.0.4 claim support, but implementation is too buggy to be useful. Partial support in other Safari browsers refers to other buggy behavior.

json.title: JSON parsing
json.description: Method of converting JavaScript objects to JSON strings and JSON back to objects using JSON.stringify() and JSON.parse()
json.notes: Requires document to be in IE8+ [standards mode](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc288325(VS.85).aspx) to work in IE8.

classlist.title: classList (DOMTokenList )
classlist.description: Method of easily manipulating classes on elements, using the DOMTokenList object.

text-overflow.title: CSS3 Text-overflow
text-overflow.description: Append ellipsis when text overflows its containing element

webm.title: WebM video format
webm.description: Multimedia format designed to provide a royalty-free, high-quality open video compression format for use with HTML5 video. WebM supports the video codec VP8 and VP9.

links.title: Info on supporting WebM in Safari

webm.notes: Will work in IE9+ and Safari/MacOSX provided the user has the WebM codecs installed. Partial support indicates that at least one codec is supported but not all.

mpeg4.title: MPEG-4/H.264 video format
mpeg4.description: Commonly used video compression format (not royalty-free)

links.title: Firefox extension allowing support in Win7

mpeg4.notes: The Android 2.3 browser currently requires [specific handling](http://www.broken-links.com/2010/07/08/making-html5-video-work-on-android-phones/) to play videos. Firefox [will include support](http://blog.lizardwrangler.com/2012/03/18/video-user-experience-and-our-mission/) on some platforms in upcoming versions. Firefox supports H.264 on Windows 7 and later since version 21. Firefox supports H.264 on Linux since version 26 if the appropriate gstreamer plug-ins are installed. Partial support for Firefox refers to the lack of support in OSX & some Linux platforms, for Android Firefox it refers to the inability of hardware acceleration.

wordwrap.title: CSS3 Overflow-wrap
wordwrap.description: Allows lines to be broken within words if an otherwise unbreakable string is too long to fit.
wordwrap.notes: Partial support refers to requiring the legacy name "word-wrap" (rather than overflow-wrap) to work.

progressmeter.title: Progress & Meter
progressmeter.description: Method of indicating a progress state (progress element) or the current level of a gauge (meter element).

links.title: Examples of progress and meter elements

progressmeter.notes: Partial support in Firefox 6-15, IE10 & iOS7 Safari refers to supporting the progress element, but not the meter element. iOS7 Safari also does not support "indeterminate" progress elements.

object-fit.title: CSS3 object-fit/object-position
object-fit.description: Method of specifying how an object (image or video) should fit inside its box. object-fit options include "contain" (fit according to aspect ratio), "fill" (stretches object to fill) and "cover" (overflows box but maintains ratio), where object-position allows the object to be repositioned like background-image does.

xhr2.title: XMLHttpRequest 2
xhr2.description: Adds more functionality to AJAX requests like file uploads, transfer progress information and the ability to send form data.

minmaxwh.title: CSS min/max-width/height
minmaxwh.description: Method of setting a minimum or maximum width or height to an element.
minmaxwh.notes: IE7 does not support "inherit" as a value on any of these properties. IE8 has some bugs with max-width/height combined with overflow: auto/scroll.

details.title: Details & Summary elements
details.description: The <details> element generates a simple no-JavaScript widget to show/hide element contents, optionally by clicking on its child <summary> element.

text-stroke.title: CSS text-stroke
text-stroke.description: Method of declaring the outline (stroke) width and color for text.
text-stroke.notes: Does not yet appear in any W3C specification. Was briefly included in a spec as the "text-outline" property, but this was removed.

inline-block.title: CSS inline-block
inline-block.description: Method of displaying an element as a block while flowing it with text.
inline-block.notes: Only supported in IE6 and IE7 on elements with a display of "inline" by default. [Alternative properties](http://blog.mozilla.com/webdev/2009/02/20/cross-browser-inline-block/) are available to provide complete cross-browser support.

notifications.title: Web Notifications
notifications.description: Method of alerting the user outside of a web page by displaying notifications (that do not require interaction by the user).

stream.title: getUserMedia/Stream API
stream.description: Method of accessing external device data (such as a webcam video stream). Formerly this was envisioned as the <device> element.

svg-img.title: SVG in HTML img element
svg-img.description: Method of displaying SVG images in HTML using <img>

datalist.title: Datalist element
datalist.description: Method of setting a list of options for a user to select in a text field, while leaving the ability to enter a custom value.
datalist.notes: Partial support in IE10 refers to [significantly buggy behavior](http://playground.onereason.eu/2013/04/ie10s-lousy-support-for-datalists/).

dataset.title: dataset & data-* attributes
dataset.description: Method of applying and accessing custom data to elements.
dataset.notes: All browsers can already use data-* attributes and access them using getAttribute. "Supported" refers to accessing the values using the dataset property. Current spec only refers to support on HTML elements, only some browsers also have support for SVG/MathML elements.

css-grid.title: CSS Grid Layout
css-grid.description: Method of using a grid concept to lay out content, providing a mechanism for authors to divide available space for lay out into columns and rows using a set of predictable sizing behaviors

menu.title: Toolbar/context menu
menu.description: Method of defining a toolbar menu, a context menu or a list of (interactive) options using the <menu> element.
menu.notes: Partial support in Firefox refers to being limited to context menus, not toolbar menus.

rem.title: rem (root em) units
rem.description: Type of unit similar to "em", but relative only to the root element, not any parent element. Thus compounding does not occur as it does with "em" units.

ttf.title: TTF/OTF - TrueType and OpenType font support
ttf.description: Support for the TrueType (.ttf)and OpenType (.otf) outline font formats in @font-face.

links.title: What is the status of TTF support in Internet Explorer?

ttf.notes: Partial support in IE9 refers to the fonts only working [when set to be "installable"](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ie/archive/2010/07/15/the-css-corner-better-web-typography-for-better-design.aspx).

touch.title: Touch events
touch.description: Method of registering when, where and how the interface is touched, for devices with a touch screen. These DOM events are similar to mousedown, mousemove, etc.

links.title: Internet Explorer's gesture and touch implementation.
Touch polyfill for supporting touch events on Internet Explorer

touch.notes:
Internet Explorer implements Pointer Events specification which supports more input devices than Touch Events one.

Removed support in Firefox refers to desktop Firefox only.

matchesselector.title: matches() DOM method
matchesselector.description: Method of testing whether or not a DOM element matches a given selector. Formerly known (and largely supported with prefix) as matchesSelector.
matchesselector.notes: Partial support refers to supporting the older specification's "matchesSelector" name rather than just "matches".

pointer-events.title: CSS pointer-events (for HTML)
pointer-events.description: This CSS property, when set to "none" allows elements to not receive hover/click events, instead the event will occur on anything behind it.
pointer-events.notes: Already part of the SVG specification, and all SVG-supporting browsers appear to support the property on SVG elements.

blobbuilder.title: Blob constructing
blobbuilder.description: Construct Blobs (binary large objects) either using the BlobBuilder API (deprecated) or the Blob constructor.
blobbuilder.notes: Partial support refers to only supporting the now deprecated BlobBuilder to create blobs.

filereader.title: FileReader API
filereader.description: Method of reading the contents of a File or Blob object into memory

filesystem.title: Filesystem & FileWriter API
filesystem.description: Method of reading and writing files to a sandboxed file system.
filesystem.notes: The File API: Directories and System specification is no longer being maintained and support may be dropped in future versions.

bloburls.title: Blob URLs
bloburls.description: Method of creating URL handles to the specified File or Blob object.

rellist.title: relList (DOMTokenList)
rellist.description: Method of easily manipulating rel attribute values on elements, using the DOMTokenList object (similar to classList).

typedarrays.title: Typed Arrays
typedarrays.description: JavaScript typed arrays provide a mechanism for accessing raw binary data much more efficiently.

deviceorientation.title: DeviceOrientation events
deviceorientation.description: API for detecting orientation and motion events from the device running the browser.
deviceorientation.notes: Partial support refers to the lack of compassneedscalibration event. Partial support also refers to the lack of devicemotion event support for Chrome 30- and Opera. Opera Mobile 14 lost the ondevicemotion event support. Firefox 3.6, 4 and 5 support the non-standard [MozOrientation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/DOM/MozOrientation) event.

script-defer.title: defer attribute for external scripts
script-defer.description: The boolean defer attribute on script elements allows the external JavaScript file to run when the DOM is loaded, without delaying page load first.
script-defer.notes: Partial support refers to a buggy implementation in IE<10

nav-timing.title: Navigation Timing API
nav-timing.description: API for accessing timing information related to navigation and elements.

audio-api.title: Web Audio API
audio-api.description: High-level JavaScript API for processing and synthesizing audio

links.title: Additional browser compatibility tests for specific features
Polyfill to support Web Audio API in Firefox
Polyfill to enable Web Audio API through Firefox Audio Data api or flash

audio-api.notes: Firefox versions < 25 support an alternative, deprecated audio API.

css-regions.title: CSS Regions
css-regions.description: Method of flowing content into multiple elements.
css-regions.notes: Support in IE10 and IE11 is limited to using an iframe as a content source with the `-ms-flow-into: flow_name;` and `-ms-flow-from: flow_name;` syntax.

fullscreen.title: Full Screen API
fullscreen.description: API for allowing content (like a video or canvas element) to take up the entire screen.
fullscreen.notes: Partial support refers to supporting an earlier draft of the spec.

requestanimationframe.title: requestAnimationFrame
requestanimationframe.description: API allowing a more efficient way of running script-based animation, compared to traditional methods using timeouts.

input-range.title: Range input type
input-range.description: Form field type that allows the user to select a value using a slider widget.
input-range.notes: Currently all Android browsers with partial support hide the slider input field by default. However, the element [can be styled](http://tiffanybbrown.com/2012/02/07/input-typerange-and-androids-stock-browser/) to be made visible and usable.

matchmedia.title: matchMedia
matchmedia.description: API for finding out whether or not a media query applies to the document.

input-datetime.title: Date/time input types
input-datetime.description: Form field widget to easily allow users to enter dates and/or times, generally by using a calendar widget.
input-datetime.notes: Safari provides date-formatted text fields, but no real calendar widget. Partial support in Chrome refers to a missing calendar widget for the "datetime" type (and other types in older versions). Some modified versions of the Android 4.x browser do have support for date/time fields. Partial support in iOS refers to a lack of support for attributes like step, min, or max.

input-color.title: Color input type
input-color.description: Form field allowing the user to select a color.

input-number.title: Number input type
input-number.notes: iOS Safari, Android 4, Chrome for Android show number input, but do not use "step", "min" or "max" attributes or show increment/decrement buttons. Internet Explorer 10 and 11 do not show increment/decrement buttons.

iframe-sandbox.title: sandbox attribute for iframes
iframe-sandbox.description: Method of running external site pages with reduced privileges (e.g. no JavaScript) in iframes

css-counters.title: CSS Counters
css-counters.description: Method of controlling number values in generated content, using the counter-reset and counter-increment properties.

css-resize.title: CSS resize property
css-resize.description: Method of allowing an element to be resized by the user, with options to limit to a given direction.
css-resize.notes: Opera 12.10+ currently only supports the resize property for textarea elements.

input-placeholder.title: input placeholder attribute
input-placeholder.description: Method of setting placeholder text for text-like input fields, to suggest the expected inserted information.

links.title: Issue 24626: Placeholder text for an input type=

input-placeholder.notes: Partial support in older Safari and Opera versions refers to lacking placeholder support on textarea elements.

spdy.title: SPDY networking protocol
spdy.description: Networking protocol for low-latency transport of content over the web.

css-repeating-gradients.title: CSS Repeating Gradients
css-repeating-gradients.description: Method of defining a repeating linear or radial color gradient as a CSS image.
css-repeating-gradients.notes: Firefox 10+, Chrome 26+ and Opera 11.6+ also support the new "to (side)" syntax.

css-filters.title: CSS Filter Effects
css-filters.description: Method of applying filter effects (like blur, grayscale, brightness, contrast and hue) to elements, previously only possible by using SVG.
css-filters.notes:
Note that this property is significantly different from and incompatible with Microsoft's [older "filter" property](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/ms530752%28v=vs.85%29.aspx).

Partial support in Firefox 31 [only with url() version](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/filter#Browser_compatibility)

getcomputedstyle.title: getComputedStyle
getcomputedstyle.description: API to get the current computed CSS styles applied to an element. This may be the current value applied by an animation or as set by a stylesheet.
getcomputedstyle.notes:
Partial support in older Firefox versions refers to requiring the second parameter to be included.

Partial support in all other browsers refers to not supporting getComputedStyle on pseudo-elements.

word-break.title: CSS3 word-break
word-break.description: Property to prevent or allow words to be broken over multiple lines between letters.
word-break.notes: Partial support refers to supporting the "break-all" value, but not the "keep-all" value.

viewport-units.title: Viewport units: vw, vh, vmin, vmax
viewport-units.description: Length units representing 1% of the viewport size for viewport width (vw), height (vh), the smaller of the two (vmin), or the larger of the two (vmax).

links.title: Buggyfill - Polyfill that fixes buggy support

viewport-units.notes: Partial support in IE9 refers to supporting "vm" instead of "vmin". Partial support in IE10 refers to lack of "vmax" support. Partial support in iOS7 is due to buggy behavior of the "vh" unit. All other partial support refers to not supporting the "vmax" unit.

contentsecuritypolicy.title: Content Security Policy
contentsecuritypolicy.description: Mitigate cross-site scripting attacks by whitelisting allowed sources of script, style, and other resources.
contentsecuritypolicy.notes: The HTTP header is 'X-Content-Security-Policy' for Firefox until version 23 and IE10&11, and 'X-Webkit-CSP' for Chrome until version 25 and Safari until version 7. 'Content-Security-Policy' is the official W3C defined header, used by Chrome version 25 and later, Firefox version 23 and later, and Safari 7 and later.

pagevisibility.title: Page Visibility
pagevisibility.description: JavaScript API for determining whether a document is visible on the display

stricttransportsecurity.title: Strict Transport Security
stricttransportsecurity.description: Declare that a website is only accessible over a secure connection (HTTPS).

style-scoped.title: Scoped CSS
style-scoped.description: Allows CSS rules to be scoped to part of the document, based on the position of the style element.

notes_by_num.1: Enabled in Chrome though the "experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags

svg-fragment.title: SVG fragment identifiers
svg-fragment.description: Method of displaying only a part of an SVG image by defining a view ID or view box dimensions as the file's fragment identifier.
svg-fragment.notes: Partial support in Safari refers to supporting viewBox dimensions but not a view ID.

outline.title: CSS outline
outline.description: The CSS outline property is a shorthand property for setting one or more of the individual outline properties outline-style, outline-width and outline-color in a single rule. In most cases the use of this shortcut is preferable and more convenient.

links.title: CSS Basic User Interface Module Level 3

download.title: Download attribute
download.description: When used on an anchor, this attribute signifies that the resource it points to should be downloaded by the browser rather than navigate to it.

links.title: Demo: creating a text file and downloading it.

pointer.title: Pointer events
pointer.description: This specification integrates various inputs from mice, touchscreens, and pens, making separate implementations no longer necessary and authoring for cross-device pointers easier. Not to be mistaken with the unrelated "pointer-events" CSS property.

links.title: Implementation of Pointer Events in IE10
Hand.js, the polyfill for browsers only supporting Touch Events

pointer.notes: Partial support in IE10 refers the lack of pointerenter and pointerleave events. Firefox Nightly provides 'dom.w3c_pointer_events.enabled' option to support this specification starting with version 28.

user-select-none.title: CSS user-select: none
user-select-none.description: Method of preventing text/element selection using CSS.
user-select-none.notes: Currently the user-select property does not appear in any W3C specification. Support information here is only for "none" value, not others.

webp.title: WebP image format
webp.description: Image format that supports lossy and lossless compression, as well as animation and alpha transparency.

links.title: Polyfill for browsers with WebM support
Polyfill for browsers with or without WebM support (i.e. IE6-IE9, Safari/iOS version 6.1 and below; Firefox versions 24 and bel
Official website FAQ - Which web browsers natively support WebP?

webp.notes: Partial support in older Chrome, Opera and Android refers to browser not supporting lossless and alpha versions of WebP. Animated webp images are supported in Chrome 32+ and Opera 19+.

intrinsic-width.title: Intrinsic & Extrinsic Sizing
intrinsic-width.description: Allows for the heights and widths to be specified in intrinsic values using the fill-available, max-content, min-content, and fit-content properties.
intrinsic-width.notes: Prefixes are on the values, not the property names (e.g. -webkit-min-content) Firefox currently supports the "-moz-available" property rather than "-moz-fill-available".

template.title: HTML templates
template.description: Method of declaring a portion of reusable markup that is parsed but not rendered until cloned.

opus.title: Opus
opus.description: Royalty-free open audio codec by IETF, which incorporated SILK from Skype and CELT from Xiph.org, to serve higher sound quality and lower latency at the same bitrate.

links.title: Google's statement about the use of VP8 and Opus codec for WebRTC standard

opus.notes: For Opera the Linux version may be able to play it when the GStreamer module is up to date and the served mime-type is 'audio/ogg'.

jpegxr.title: JPEG XR image format
jpegxr.description: The latest JPEG image format of Joint Photographic Experts Group which boasts better compression and supports lossless compression, alpha channel, and 48-bit deep color over normal jpg format.

channel-messaging.title: Channel messaging
channel-messaging.description: Method for having two-way communication between browsing contexts (using MessageChannel)

links.title: An Introduction to HTML5 web messaging

css3-tabsize.title: CSS3 tab-size
css3-tabsize.description: Method of customizing the width of the tab character. Only effective using 'white-space: pre' or 'white-space: pre-wrap'.

mutationobserver.title: Mutation Observer
mutationobserver.description: Method for observing and reacting to changes to the DOM. Replaces MutationEvents, which is deprecated.
mutationobserver.notes: When the content of a node with a single CharacterData child node is changed by innerHTML attribute and the node have a single different one as a result, WebKit browsers consider it as a characterData mutation of the child CharacterData node, while other browsers think it as a childList mutation of the parent node.

css-selection.title: ::selection CSS pseudo-element
css-selection.description: The ::selection CSS pseudo-element applies rules to the portion of a document that has been highlighted (e.g., selected with the mouse or another pointing device) by the user.

css-placeholder.title: :placeholder-shown CSS pseudo-class
css-placeholder.description: The :placeholder-shown pseudo-class represents the placeholder contents of a form field with placeholder text.
css-placeholder.notes:
Partial support refers to support for alternative syntax: ::-webkit-input-placeholder (Chrome/Safari/Opera),
::-moz-placeholder (Firefox) and 
:-ms-input-placeholder (IE).

canvas-blending.title: Canvas blend modes
canvas-blending.description: Method of defining the effect resulting from overlaying two layers on a Canvas element.

clipboard.title: Clipboard API
clipboard.description: API to provide copy, cut and paste functionality using the OS clipboard.
clipboard.notes: Partial support in IE refers using [a non-standard method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/ms535220%28v=vs.85%29.aspx) of interacting with the clipboard. For other browsers it refers to not supporting the ClipboardEvent constructor.

rtcpeerconnection.title: WebRTC Peer-to-peer connections
rtcpeerconnection.description: Method of allowing two users to communicate directly, browser to browser using the RTCPeerConnection API.
rtcpeerconnection.notes: BlackBerry 10 recognizes RTCPeerConnection but real support is unconfirmed.

css3-cursors.title: CSS3 Cursors (original values)
css3-cursors.description: CSS3 cursor values added in the 2004 spec, including none, context-menu, cell, vertical-text, alias, copy, no-drop, not-allowed, nesw-resize, nwse-resize, col-resize, row-resize and all-scroll.
css3-cursors.notes: Internet Explorer does not support the alias, cell, copy, ew-resize, ns-resize, nesw-resize, nwse-resize or context-menu cursors. Opera 12.10- does not support 'none' or a URI.

webvtt.title: WebVTT - Web Video Text Tracks
webvtt.description: Format for marking up text captions for multimedia resources.

links.title: Getting Started With the Track Element
An Introduction to WebVTT and track

webvtt.notes:
WebVTT must be used with the <track> element.

Firefox currently lacks support for the for ::cue pseudoelement.

promises.title: Promises
promises.description: A promise represents the eventual result of an asynchronous operation.

links.title: JavaScript Promises: There and back again - HTML5 Rocks

css-sticky.title: CSS position:sticky
css-sticky.description: Keeps elements positioned as "fixed" or "relative" depending on how it appears in the viewport. As a result the element is "stuck" when necessary while scrolling.

notes_by_num.2: Enabled in Chrome though the "experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags
notes_by_num.1: Can be enabled in Firefox by setting the about:config preference layout.css.sticky.enabled to true

css-variables.title: CSS Variables
css-variables.description: Permits the declaration and usage of cascading variables in stylesheets.

vibration.title: Vibration API
vibration.description: Method to access the vibration mechanism of the hosting device.

css-backgroundblendmode.title: CSS background-blend-mode
css-backgroundblendmode.description: Allows blending between CSS background images, gradients, and colors.

css-mixblendmode.title: Blending of HTML/SVG elements
css-mixblendmode.description: Allows blending between arbitrary SVG and HTML elements

notes_by_num.1: Enabled in Chrome though the "experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags

web-speech.title: Web Speech API
web-speech.description: Method to provide speech input and text-to-speech output features in a web browser.
web-speech.notes: Partial support in Chrome refers to some attributes missing. Partial support in Safari refers to only Speech Synthesis supported.

high-resolution-time.title: High Resolution Time API
high-resolution-time.description: Method to provide the current time in sub-millisecond resolution and such that it is not subject to system clock skew or adjustments. Called using performance.now()

battery-status.title: Battery Status API
battery-status.description: Method to provide information about the battery status of the hosting device.
battery-status.notes: Support has already landed in Webkit but it is yet to make into Android and Chrome [android issue](https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=135863)  [chrome issue](https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=122593)

text-decoration.title: text-decoration styling
text-decoration.description: Method of defining the type, style and color of lines in the text-decoration property.

notes_by_num.1: Enabled in Chrome though the "experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags

speech-synthesis.title: Speech Synthesis API
speech-synthesis.description: A web API for controlling a text-to-speech output.

user-timing.title: User Timing API
user-timing.description: Method to help web developers measure the performance of their applications by giving them access to high precision timestamps.

srcset.title: Srcset attribute
srcset.description: Allows authors to specify alternate high-resolution sources on elements

links.title: Improved support for high-resolution displays with the srcset image attribute

srcset.notes: This covers the stand-alone `srcset` syntax for resolution switching, not the expanded syntax to be used in concert with `sizes`.

ambient-light.title: Ambient Light API
ambient-light.description: Defines events that provide information about the ambient light level, as measured by a device's light sensor.
ambient-light.notes: Partial support in Firefox refers to the fact that only the devicelight event is supported. In addition, Firefox desktop supports this API only on Mac OS X. [Support for Windows 7 is in progress](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=754199)

css-shapes.title: CSS Shapes Level 1
css-shapes.description: Allows geometric shapes to be set in CSS to define an area for text to flow around.

links.title: CSS shapes support test by Adobe

notes_by_num.1: Enabled in Chrome though the "experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags

domcontentloaded.title: DOMContentLoaded
domcontentloaded.description: JavaScript event, fired when the dom is loaded, but not yet stylesheets or images

proximity.title: Proximity API
proximity.description: Defines events that provide information about the distance between a device and an object, as measured by a proximity sensor.

kerning-pairs-ligatures.title: Improved kerning pairs & ligatures
kerning-pairs-ligatures.description: Currently non-standard method of improving kerning pairs & ligatures using text-rendering: optimizeLegibility.

iframe-seamless.title: seamless attribute for iframes
iframe-seamless.description: The seamless attribute makes an iframe's contents actually part of a page, and adopts the styles from its hosting page.
iframe-seamless.notes:
Chrome 20-26 had partial support behind a flag, though this was [later removed](http://crbug.com/229421). 

Safari 7 (& iOS 7 Safari) hides the border of seamless iframes and recognizes the 'seamless' DOM property, but does not provide actual support.

css-image-orientation.title: CSS3 image-orientation
css-image-orientation.description: CSS property used generally to fix the intended orientation of an image. This can be done using 90 degree increments or based on the image's EXIF data using the "from-image" value.
css-image-orientation.notes: Partial support in iOS refers to the browser using EXIF data by default, though it does not actually support the property. Opening the image in a new tab in Chrome results in the image shown in the orientation according to the EXIF data.

picture.title: Picture element
picture.description: A responsive images method to control which image resource a user agent presents to a user, based on resolution, media query and/or support for a particular image format

notes_by_num.1: Enabled in Chrome though the "experimental Web Platform features" flag in chrome://flags

woff2.title: WOFF 2.0 - A better web font compression format
woff2.description: TrueType/OpenType font that provides better compression than WOFF 1.0.

text-size-adjust.title: CSS text-size-adjust
text-size-adjust.description: On mobile devices, the text-size-adjust CSS property allows Web authors to control if and how the text-inflating algorithm is applied to the textual content of the element it is applied to.

web-animation.title: Web Animations API
web-animation.description: This function lets you create an animation purely in JavaScript and have it run as efficiently as any CSS Animation or Transition.

resource-timing.title: Resource Timing
resource-timing.description: Method to help web developers to collect complete timing information related to resources on a document.

custom-elements.title: Custom Elements
custom-elements.description: Method of defining and using new types of DOM elements in a document.

links.title: W3C Editor's Draft spec (closer to current implementations)
Chromium tracking bug: Implement Custom Elements
Firefox tracking bug: Implement Custom Elements (from Web Components)
IE Web Platform Status and Roadmap: Custom Elements
HTML5Rocks - Custom Elements: defining new elements in HTML

imports.title: HTML Imports
imports.description: Method of including and reusing HTML documents in other HTML documents.

links.title: IE Web Platform Status and Roadmap: HTML Imports
HTML5Rocks - HTML Imports: #include for the web
Chromium tracking bug: Implement HTML Imports
Firefox tracking bug: Implement HTML Imports

input-file-multiple.title: Multiple file selection
input-file-multiple.description: Allows users to select multiple files in the file picker.

notes_by_num.1: Not supported when tested on Android, presumably an OS limitation.

atob-btoa.title: Base64 encoding and decoding
atob-btoa.description: Utility functions for of encoding and decoding strings to and from base 64: window.atob() and window.btoa().

css-appearance.title: CSS Appearance
css-appearance.description: The `appearance` property defines how elements (particularly form controls) appear by default. By setting the value to `none` the default appearance can be entirely redefined using other CSS properties.
css-appearance.notes: The `appearance` property currently does not appear in any CSS specification so there is no specifically correct usage.
